name: Metalcraft
desc: Simple techniques that all with a metal companion can easily accomplish.

abilities.name: Basic Metalcraft
abilities.effect:
You have a basic, intuitive grasp of metalcraft and can accomplish minor feats using it. You gain the following:
* **Metalsense:** You have a rough knowledge of the location of all nearby metal.
* **Basic Lodecraft**: You may clumsily move and control a single nearby metal object that you could hold in one hand.
* **Basic Anvilcraft**: You may touch a piece of metal and affect minor change on it, such as making it stronger, weaker, or slightly changing its shape. This change is temporary, and ends if you stop touching the metal.

Your Spirit may take 1 _Fatigue_ to enhance these abilities for a Scene, allowing you to temporarily exceed these limits.

abilities.name: Metalbending
abilities.effect: You have _Kinesis_ [_Metal_] within _Close_- Range. Additionally, you may use _Brawl_ against all Targets made of _Metal_ or wearing _Metal_ Armor within that Range. If you choose the <u>Steal</u> option, you may instead Target any creature, but must Target a _Metal_ piece of _Equipment_.

abilities.name: Metal Shot
abilities.missile: An Unattended 0 _Load_/_Trinket_ _Metal_ item or one _Worn by you/an ally within _Close_- Range.
abilities.effect: Choose a Missile, then Attack a target within Range with it. If you choose a _Trinket_, add _Feeble_ to this Attack. After resolving the Attack, place the Missile unattended in the Target's _Arena_.
abilities.special: If the _Missile_ has an Attack with _Slash_ or _Stab_ you may replace _Crush_ with said keyword.

enhancements.name: Power Shot
enhancements.effect: You may instead use a _Load_ 1 item as the _Missile_. Deal +_1/1/2/2_ Damage if you do.

name: Novice Anvilcraft
desc: The fundamentals of anvilcraft, a speciality of metalcraft that focuses on changing the structure of metal to strengthen, weaken, or alter the shape of it.

abilities.name: Novice Anvilcraft
abilities.effect: You are studied in the basics of anvilcraft, allowing you to better manipulate metal. You can modify the physical properties of metal to a moderate degree, allowing you to make iron as hard as steel or the opposite. For the full effect you must be touching the metal, but the effect persists for a short time after you stop touching it. You may affect more mild change from a short distance. Finally, you can shape metal with your touch with the same precision and speed as if you had metalworking tools (but not a forge) and you do not need _Smith's Tools_ to repair metal equipment.

abilities.name: Fullmetal
abilities.effect:
Your equipment is sharper, harder, and otherwise more deadly than others. Gain the following:
* Whenever your [_Metal_] _Equipment_ would lose _Durability_ (even in narrative play) roll a d6; on a 6, it instead doesn't. Your _Spirit_ may take 1 _Fatigue_ to treat a failed roll as a success.
* Your Attacks using [_Metal_] Equipment gain [_Pierce_ 1].
* You gain +1 _Block_ if you _Block_ while _Wielding_ [_Metal_] Equipment or _Wearing_ [_Metal_] _Armor_.

imbues.name: Honed Edge
imbues.effect: In addition, deal +1 Damage with Attacks using [_Metal_] Equipment.

imbues.name: Hardened Hide
imbues.effect: In addition, gain +1 _Block_ if you're wearing [_Metal_] Armor, +1 if you're wearing at least 4 _Slots_ of it.

abilities.name: Perfect Edge
abilities.effect: Add [_Pierce_] 2 and _Sunder_ [_Reflex_]. If the Target Blocks, you must Target Wielded Equipment if possible. If you successfully _Sunder_, inflict 1 _Stun_ on all other creatures you are _Engaged_ with.

abilities.name: Shatter Spears
abilities.effect:
You have _Advantage_ to _Negate_ against _Sunder_ targeting _Metal_ Equipment this _Turn_ and gain +2 _Block_. If you lose no _Stamina_ from and are not _Sundered_ by the triggering Attack, choose one:
* _Sunder_ the weapon used for the Attack.
* Inflict _Exposed_/_Impaired_ [5 _Reflex_] on the Attacker if they are in _Melee_ Range
* Gain 1 _Block_.

name: Woodcraft
desc: Simple techniques that all with a wood companion can easily accomplish.

abilities.name: Basic Woodcraft
abilities.effect:
You have a basic, intuitive grasp of woodcraft. You gain the following:
* **Range**: Your woodcraft has a range of approximately 30 meters.
* **Woodsense:** You have a rough knowledge of the location of all wood within your wood range.
* **Leaf Arts**: You may move and control wooden objects up to 15 pounds, with good precision at low weights and decent precision at higher weights.
* **Bark Arts:** You may slightly shape wood, bending or warping it a few centimeters. This change is temporary, and ends if you stop concentrating.

Your Spirit may take 1 _Fatigue_ to double the effect of any of these abilities temporarily.

abilities.name: Woodbending
abilities.effect: You have _Kinesis_ [_Wood_] within _Close_- Range. Additionally, you may use _Brawl_ against all Targets made of _Wood_ or wearing _Wood_ Armor within that Range. If you choose the <u>Steal</u> option, you instead must Target a _Wood_ piece of _Equipment_.

abilities.name: Wooden Splinter
abilities.effect: Pick a 0 _Load_ _Wood_ item within _Close_- Range to use as _Ammunition_, then Attack a target within Range. You may also use this if there is a _Wood_ _Source_ within _Close_- Range, creating a 0 _Load_ Wooden Spike as _Ammunition_.
abilities.special: If the Item used for this has an Attack with _Crush_ or _Slash_ you may replace _Stab_ with said keyword.

enhancements.name: Heavy Splinter
enhancements.effect: You instead use a _Load_ 1 item as _Ammunition_, or create a 1 _Load_ Wooden Spike as _Ammunition_ from a _Wood_ _Source_ within _Close_- Range. Deal +_1/1/2/2_ Damage.

name: Blacksmith
desc: You are skilled at working with metal and, given a forge and time, can create a variety of tools and arms.

abilities.name: Strength of the Forge
abilities.effect: You are used to long hours working in the forge, which has given you a strong back, endurance, and the ability to use a wide variety of heavy tools. Additionally, when seeing another smith's hands, tools, or forge you can get a sense of their skill level and personality. This ability works to a lesser extent when you see a piece of their handiwork.

abilities.name: Metallurgy
abilities.effect: You are well-versed in different types of metal, and can easily identify most metals and their properties at a glance. For those that you cannot, you at least have a general sense of their properties. Additionally, you have a deep understanding of metal craftsmanship, and can easily identify the strongest and weakest point on something made of metal, if they exist.

abilities.name: Metalworking
abilities.effect:
When you _Mend_ while _Resting_ you automatically succeed if the item is _Metal_. Additionally, if you have access to the appropriate tools, gain the following _Camp Action_:
* <u>Field Repair</u>: Choose a _Destroyed_ piece of _Metal_ _Equipment_. Spend 1 piece of _Scrap_, then restore it to 1 _Durability_.

abilities.name: Forge-Trained
abilities.effect:
Given appropriate tools and materials, you may craft Metal equipment. Most basic or rough tools can be crafted in a few hours, with more intricate or complicated tools taking longer. Whenever you <u>Improve</u> the Forge in your town during _Downtime_, mark +1 segment on the Clock. Finally, whenever you can craft, add the following <u>Augments</u> to your Smithy:
* <u>Elegant:</u> Increase the _Supply_ cost of the item by 2. This item is of noticeably higher quality and is very desirable to own.
* <u>Sturdy:</u> Increase the _Supply_ cost of the item by 1. Increase its _Durability_ by 1 as well.
* <u>Mass-Produced:</u> Decrease the _Supply_ cost of the item by 1. Decrease its _Durability_ by 1. If it already has 1 _Durability_, instead add _Fragile_.

name: Weaponsmith
desc: You specialize in crafting weapons of war, and few are your equal when crafting them.

abilities.name: Weapon Academia
abilities.effect: You are well-versed in different types of weapons, as well as how they are made. You intuitively understand the function, craftsmanship, and cultural significance of weapons, and can accurately assess the condition of a weapon at a glance. Additionally, from a weapon, you can gain insight into its maker, the culture it comes from, and skill level of the wielder.

abilities.name: Higher Quality
abilities.effect:
During Downtime you may work on your allies' weapons, making them visibly of higher quality and granting yourself and all party members a Weaponsmith's Blessing at the start of each _Journey_. A character make expend their Weaponsmith's Blessing for one of the following effects:
* In a Skill Challenge, when the weapon is granting a die, you may gain an additional die.
* After making an Attack with a Weapon, you may expend the blessing to use a _Gambit_, even if you didn't qualify for one.
* When a Weapon would lose _Durability_, you may expend the Weaponsmith's Blessing to instead not lose _Durability_.

 
Finally, gain the following _Camp Action_:
* <u>Hone</u>: Choose an ally that does not have a Weaponsmith's Blessing. You take the time to ensure their equipment is in working order, granting them a Weaponsmith's Blessing.

abilities.name: Weapon Maintenance
abilities.effect: When you _Mend_ while _Resting_ you automatically succeed if the item is a weapon. Additionally, whenever you make camp, you may take the <u>Mend</u> or <u>Hone</u> _Camp Action_ without expending your _Camp Action_ for the day. When you do, roll a d6; on a 2-, you cannot use this ability until it is _Recovered_.

abilities.name: Forge Weapon
abilities.effect: Given appropriate tools and materials, you may craft Weapons. All but the most crude of weapons take some time to craft. Whenever you <u>Improve</u> the Forge in your town during _Downtime_ you may also learn a new weapon <u>Augment</u>. Additionally, when you gain this Talent learn two Augments of your choice. With further training, you may learn to work with Exotic materials.

name: Tough
desc: You are exceptionally tough, pushing through any difficulty with determination and grit.

abilities.name: Exceptional Toughness
abilities.effect: You are resilient against punishment and can push through effects that would stop lesser creatures in their track. You are resistant to pain, toxins, and other afflictions to a frightening degree and seem to have a never-ending pool of stamina. This does not grant dice on _Travel Rolls_, but may be treated as a piece of appropriate Equipment when dealing with travel conditions that toughness would aid with.

abilities.name: Grin and Bear It
abilities.effect: When you would gain Hunger, Thirst, Fatigue, or a similar Affliction you may place it on this Ability instead of your Health Bar, ignoring its effect. You recover from this effect as normal, and may use this Power once there is no longer an Affliction on it.

abilities.name: Toughness
abilities.effect: Gain +5 Stamina. At _Refresh_, lose half as much _Stun_ as you would normally lose to Afflictions (such as _Fatigue_).

abilities.name: True Grit
abilities.effect: The triggering effect cannot reduce you below 1 _Stamina_. Automatically succeed any roll to _Negate_ with _Grit_/_Focus_ on the triggering Attack.

name: Charming
desc: You have an easy smile and an innate charm, making others feel at ease in your presence.

abilities.name: Exceptional Charm
abilities.effect: You have an innate quality about you that puts people at ease in your presence. Strangers warm to you quickly, are quick to offer a helping hand, and are more likely to share information with you.

abilities.name: First Impression
abilities.effect: When meeting a new character you may charm them temporarily, causing them to treat you a bit better than they normally would, allowing you to interact neutrally with a character that dislikes you or acting as a friend with a character that you are only acquaintances with. If you attempt a _Skill Challenge_ against this character in the same _Scene_, you may roll _Skillfully_. You may use this Ability once per day for free, with each successive use costing a _Stress_ to use.

abilities.name: Charming Presence
abilities.effect: Gain +1 _Focus_. At _Refresh_ one ally within _Short_- Range may gain _Joyful_.

abilities.name: Charm Offensive
abilities.effect: The Target gains 1 _Stun_, then must Negate [5 _Focus_]. On a failure, they have _Disadvantage_ to attack you until you make a hostile action against them, or they become afflicted with a similar effect.
